utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about Penny’s depressing acting career?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. I mean, it’s been a little tough, but Penny’s following her dreams, and in my book, that is not depressing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is that book called Lies I Tell to Get Sex?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that a real book? I would totally read that book.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can I borrow it when you’re done?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’ll have you guys know I turned down a part in a movie last week.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Serial Ape-ist? I thought you died in that.

utterance.content: She does. 42 minutes in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: While showering topless, 16 minutes after brief side butt during a pillow fight with her sorority sisters.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have an eidetic memory. I don’t know what his problem is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, there are no shower scenes in this one. They just try to clone me from my corpse, but my DNA gets mixed with the ape’s DNA and I end up running around with giant gorilla hands and feet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Am I missing something, or isn’t that the part she was born to play?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So are you really not gonna do this movie?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I don’t think it’s the kind of part that’s good for my career.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, but don’t a lot of famous actors get their start doing bad movies?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t think Meryl Streep ever had to say “Must keep gorilla hands from killing again!”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If she did, it would be amazing. That woman can do no wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know anything about show business, so if you think it’s reasonable to turn down paid work and just burn through your savings, I’m sure you know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think we’re gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? We were making fun of failed careers. We didn’t get to tap the juicy vein that is Howard’s.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can I ask you something? Why do you constantly feel the need to put down my husband?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sure he does it out of love. The same way my boyfriend makes me feel terrible about my life choices.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think we’re gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no. This is not a fight. I was just excited that someone offered you a part and a little surprised that you’d rather sit at home and do nothing than take it. Now it’s a fight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, with that sorted out, I’m happy to answer your question, Bernadette. Howard started it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything. I was just sitting here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wasn’t referring to this evening. Ten years ago, upon first seeing me, your husband claimed that I looked like C-3PO and Pee-wee Herman. And he called me C-3P-wee Herman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ha-a-a. Still funny.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That was ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nine years, 11 months and three weeks ago, he followed that up by replacing the slides for my lecture with photographs of nude fat women bending over.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The lecture was on cosmic gas clouds. That’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was there. It was funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In any event, that began a decade-long progression of insults, pranks and unwanted magazine subscriptions. To this day, I still get a monthly copy of Granny on Granny. Which, other than its surprisingly fun puzzle page, is complete filth.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thanks for walking me to my car.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, it’s for both of us. Last night, I watched West Side Story, and I’m a little freaked out by street gangs.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why can’t Raj find a girl? The mystery continues.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t appreciate your sarcasm, but we’ve still got two blocks to go, so I’ll put up with it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Whatever happened with your online dating?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No one was writing me back, so I stopped checking my profile.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Before I met Sheldon, I was ready to give up, too. Once, I even dropped in on my OBGYN just to get some human contact.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It has been a while since I got my prostate checked.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Then I met Sheldon and look at where we are now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? You’ve kissed, like, once in three years.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s true. Do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Listen, I was thinking you and I could probably try to be better friends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? I was thinking what we have now is a bit much.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Seriously, I was talking to Bernadette last night and she made some great points. You and I have known each other a long time, and I didn’t hear the rest ’cause she took her bra off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. How do you propose we move forward?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, for starters, we could stop insulting each other.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a great idea. And in the spirit of our new arrangement, I will mask my surprise that you came up with it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyway, I got invited to do a little talk at NASA in Houston this weekend. They gave me two tickets. Bernadette can’t go. You want to come with me? You can visit your mom, and I’ll show you around the space centre.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have one question. Is this a prank where we land in Houston and you’ve made up wanted posters that have my face with a moustache and a Spanish name and then I get arrested and deported to South America?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m glad because I would not have seen that coming.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Amy, I could use some help.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Let me guess. There’s an undergrad in a leather jacket snapping his fingers by the water fountain.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I thought about what you said last night, and I went back on the dating Web site and I was looking at this girl’s profile. She’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, she’s cute. And smart. Phi Beta Kappa.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And judging by her lack of Adam’s apple, she’s been female her entire life. I like that in a woman.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great, so what do you need me for?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I was up all night trying to write to her, but I wanted to run it by you first.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Emily, your face is like a precious dew-kissed flower.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know. Powerful stuff, huh?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. You’re supposed to be yourself, not all desperate and creepy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I’m getting some mixed messages here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just say something normal like, I saw your profile. Looks like we have a lot in common, let’s get a cup of coffee sometime.”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes. Where I can be jealous of the cup touching your ruby lips. Or you just write it for me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not gonna pretend to be you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t want you to pretend to be me. You can be like my, uh, online wingman. Like if we met her at a bar and you talked me up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, what would I say to her?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just tell her what I’m really like. And, if you think it’ll help, that you saw me changing once and my package reminded you of the muscular tail of a jaguar. Use your own words.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks again for taking me to the pharmacy.

utterance.content: Oh, it’s no problem. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m fine. It’s just some, uh, stomach medication for my trip. There’s the remote yet distinct possibility that I may end up in South America.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Remember the old days when I would’ve said something dumb like why? Uh, that doesn’t sound good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Remember the old days when I used to point out that your check engine light was on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, get ready to stroll down memory lane. Penny, your check engine…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I know it’s on, Sheldon. Oh, no, no, no, no, no. I cannot afford this right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, in that case, I’d like to be partnered with my good friend Howard.

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I really don’t think we do tha…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do that. See?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe I can go with you guys to Houston?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Isn’t it a little late to get plane tick…

utterance.content: Plane tickets? Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Will you please sto…

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I did. I called them. The part’s gone. They gave it to someone else. Now that girl’s gonna get discovered and become famous and go on Letterman and talk about how she got her big break on a cheap monkey movie all because some dumb girl thought it was beneath her.

utterance.speaker: Amy

utterance.speaker: Amy

utterance.speaker: Amy

utterance.speaker: Howard

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Why wouldn’t I want to get my old job back? It’ll be fun to see everyone. I haven’t talked to them since I said I quit, see you at the Oscars, bitches. Come on, let’s just get this over with.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. Thank you.

utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just so humiliating.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, don’t look so sad. You never know what’s gonna happen. Maybe tonight will be great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, I know you’re trying to make me feel better, and I love you for that, but it’s making me feel worse, and I kind of hate you. This isn’t your car.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t say anything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I mean, you could say thank you. I did just buy you a car.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Look, I admit that it’s odd that Rajesh didn’t write to you himself, but if you get to know him, you’ll see he’s just a sweet, regular guy. As a counterpoint, here he is, uninvited and visibly sweaty.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello, Emily.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Amy told me you were concerned that I might be too passive and shy. Let me ask you something. Would a passive guy barge in here to look you in the eye and say, hey, dew-kissed flower, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No, but a weird guy with no boundaries might.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, okay, that’s a separate issue. Let’s put a pin in that and just focus on the passive thing.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are we still going to go to that Chaucer reading Friday?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You know, I think I’m just gonna go by myself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not my best first date. Yeah, but not my worst, either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry for every mean thing I ever did or said to you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, too. It’s all my fault.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you weren’t my friend, there’d be a hole in my life.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kind of like when Firefly was cancelled. But not as big.

utterance.speaker: Announcement
utterance.content: The captain has turned off the fasten seat belt sign. You’re now free to move about the cabin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s over.

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
